page.title: 11Our Local Church
page.content: Our local church is quite an interesting one. Its tower is separated from the church. The tower was built before the church. When the Civil War came, one side shot arrows at the tower. On Tuesday, some of the local people ring the bells in the bell tower. Sometime in the spring our new vicar was inducted. He is much more lively than the last vicar. Every fortnight we go to a family service in Westbury Church. There is a lay- reader. I like the family service because it is not dull it is lively and it has lively songs too. Sometimes the lay-reader explains hard things in a more simple way to the children. After the service we have coffee and biscuits. When it was the family service's first birthday we had a birthday cake to celebrate.
